intro: Scabiosa broussonetii, commonly known as the Persian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa broussonetii is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
